title: Reinforcement Learning-Based Control Policy Design: Homotopy Initialization Strategy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Control Theory, Linear Algebra, Calculus, and Fundamental Programming Skills
context.additional_context: Advanced corporate trainees with experience in mathematical modeling and algorithm design, utilizing self-directed learning materials in a non-real-time environment

learning_goals: Design stabilization control policies using homotopy-based initialization strategies in continuous-time systems
Explain the principles of placing system poles into stable regions by comparing model-based and data-based homotopic policy iteration techniques
A reinforcement learning-based control policy design procedure can be implemented using simulation tools in environments with unknown system dynamics
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
